definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: be not, scorched, burn poet. & late (Ar. h.ar=un be hot, burn, thirst; Eth. h.arara: Aram. [[חַר]]; cf. As. arâru, glow, SASm:Asrb. i. p. 97 Belser:BAS ii. 155)—
be hot, scorched, Jerus., under fig. of caldron Ez Eze 24:11.
burn = be burned, fig. of men, in ´[[י]]'s judgement, Is 24:6.
burn, of bones of sick men in fever [[מִנִּי־חׂרֶב]] ´[[ח]] Job 30:30.

be scorched, of bellows [[מַפֻּחַ]] in fierce fire Je 6:29 (fig.); scorched, charred, of the vine (as fuel) Ez Eze 15:4, Eze 15:5 middle part charred, the ends devoured ([[אכל]]) by fire (sim. of inhab. of Jerus.); bones (sim. id.) Ez Eze 24:10 (v. supr.).
burn, of bones in fever Ps 102:4 ([[כְּמוֹקֵד]], cf.

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Job 30:30); be parched, of throat [[גרוני]] ´[[נח]] Ps 69:4.—Is 41:11, Is 45:24, Ct So 1:6 v. [[חרה]].
